metadata.title: CVE-2021-3709 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Function check_attachment_for_errors() in file data/general-hooks/ubuntu.pycould be tricked into exposing private data via a constructed crash file.This issue affects: apport 2.14.1 versions prior to2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm8; 2.20.1 versions prior to 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm2;2.20.9 versions prior to 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.26; 2.20.11 versions prior to2.20.11-0ubuntu27.20; 2.20.11 versions prior to 2.20.11-0ubuntu65.3;

criterions.comment: apport: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
